alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Sandusky; Seneca; Wood; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 3:55PM EST until February 27 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Seneca County in northwestern Ohio... Northwestern Wyandot County in northwestern Ohio... Western Sandusky County in northwestern Ohio... Southern Wood County in northwestern Ohio... Hancock County in northwestern Ohio... * Until 445 PM EST. * At 354 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Deshler to near Ottawa to near Lima, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Findlay, Bowling Green, Tiffin, Fremont, Fostoria, Upper Sandusky, Bluffton, North Baltimore, Gibsonburg, Woodville, McComb, Weston, Forest, Arlington, Elmore, Arcadia, Rawson, Vanlue, Van Buren and New Riegel. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
